message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.SD

This paper investigates the structure and evolution of knowledge spillovers across technological domains using patent citations, which falls under the field of information science and technology. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Additionally, the paper uses link prediction to forecast the evolution of cross-domain patent networks, which could also fit under cs.CY (Computers and Society) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The paper also analyzes dynamic technology networks, which could fall under cs.DL (Digital Libraries) and cs.SD (Software Engineering).
